Author: simianstyle
Content: http://designoutpost.com - you pay a set fee, and a slew of designers make a logo based on your description. They then iterate till they get it right, and don't get paid till you choose one. Pretty good methodology, i've tried it twice and got what I wanted both times.\n

Author: staunch
Content:
Use Inkscape[1] and do it yourself. It's amazing what even a newbie can do with it in an hour or two. You can always pay someone to make a slicker version later, which will be much easier if you have something to use as a base.

1. http://www.inkscape.org/

Author: paul
Content: My login lasts for weeks. Is this just a matter of session vs stored cookies? If so, it should be easy to write a little bookmarklet which makes your cookie non-session.

Author: hacker64
Content: Try http://thelogocompany.net/ . Haven't used them, but there examples are cool. Or, post on elance and see if someone good bids.

Author: reitzensteinm
Content: It's a joke - I know we couldn't fix it, I just want to see the source. :)

Author: jward
Content:
Kind of a neat tool, but I didn't see anything that caught my eye. Except the price. A hundred bucks for a logo I design myself online with no designer even telling me it's crap is just a little excessive.

My recommendation is to find a design student and offer 'em a hundred bucks for a logo.
